reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We arrived at the Eridanus with a scary late night cab ride from the airport. We were greeted by the excellent front desk staff and our room was upgraded to an Acropolis view room. Our friends that arrived the next day didn't get an upgrade because the hotel was full but the staff was very accomodating.
reviews.title: Great Upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The rooms were very comfortable although the shower is somewhat odd with the toilet in the shower area.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: One of the best restaurants in Athens, Varoulko, is right next door.
reviews.title: Great Find In A Great Neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's breakfast buffet is one of the best I've had.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in Athens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: After spending many stays at five star chain hotels (Hilton, Sheraton etc.) the Hotel Eridanus provided somewhat of a refreshing feeling. Those other hotels know that they can charge what they want for any ammenity, but the Eridanus was different and that is why I liked it so much.
reviews.title: Great Property, Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Eridanus Hotel is located within ten minutes of the Kerameikos metro station on the busy street of Odos Pireos. This makes it very convenient for those not wanting to take a taxi, as it is possible to get to Syntagma and Kolonaki on the same line. Also, the Kerameikos area is up and coming; there are a number of interesting cafes and bars around the metro station in addition to a number of gay bars and clubs within walking distance of the hotel. The area itself is not beautiful, but the rooftop bars in the area are great (one had a view of the Acropolis), and there are a few restaurants in the area worth trying.
reviews.title: Perfectly Located, Wonderful Service and Room

likes.disliked: — Expensive Cocktails at the Rooftop Bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: As for the hotel itself, the staff is very efficient and accommodating. A bellhop took our bags as soon as we entered; no tip was expected. Our room was on the ground floor facing the back, and we had a nice view of the hotel's garden with a small balcony. The shower was magnificent with green marble and multiple shower heads with the sink mirror visible inside the stall. The toilet is also inside the stall, but I thought this was a creative use of space. The beds were very comfortable and the furnishings and floor were beautiful. The breakfast was delicious and was served inside a small sunroom with a waterfall. I would highly recommend a stay here; it is well worth the price paid.
reviews.title: A Great Value Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our two night stay here, we were travelling as a family of six. The hotel staff were very helpful, breakfast was the best we had out of all our hotels. The triple rooms are spacious, the free soft drinks were an added bonus and the view from the roof top bar is to die for. We would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Room No. 501 Makes the Eridanus a Treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Eridanus is a fine hotel located on busy Piraeus Street, across from the Kerameikos Cemetary, a few blocks from the archaeological promenade, which winds around the southern part of the Acropolis, and several blocks from the nearest Metro station. Our pleasant stay there was due mainly to our room, No. 501, which is on the top floor with rooms (the hotel's restaurant, Parea, is above, on the roof), and which has a large outdoor patio with a dining table and a terrific view of the Acropolis. The highlight of our stay was having a simple dinner (including french fries among the best I've had) from Parea on our patio where we enjoyed the privacy, the warm evening air, and the view of the Acropolis. This opportunity alone recommends the Eridanus. Our room was spacious and clean, and included a large flat-screen television, and the service and complimentary breakfast were very good. The drawbacks were that the hotel did not offer a public computer with access to the Internet (although Wi-Fi was available to those who brought their own computer); its location on a noisy street (although in No. 501 noise from the street was slight); and its distance of several minutes by foot from both the Metro and the area around the Acropolis. But these were small trade-offs for the experience of staying in No. 501. I strongly recommend that room if you choose the Eridanus.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprise - Great luxury hotel in Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I (19 and 22 respectively) stayed with Eridanus on 5/22 for one night before heading off to Mykonos and then Santorini.
reviews.title: Liked Eridanus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I spend 2 nights at Eridanus hotel .First of all the location of the hotel is ok but you have to be careful if you walk on Pireaus street to Omonoia square . The rooms are beautiful and clean with big bathrooms and beds. I didn't like the breakfast and the restaurant was too dark . The variety of it was poor for a 5 star hotel.I also didn't like the view from my window which was old buildings.The staff was ok.Also soft drinks are free of charge in the minibar.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but...

likes.disliked: — The location is a bit weird if you don't know Athens

reviews.title: Highly recommend it.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Eridanus before and after a cruise. The Eridanus is a modern, boutique style "art" hotel, very nicely decorated, airy and clean. We booked a deluxe room that faced a courtyard. It was neither small nor large but still quite comfortable and a good bed. All the bathrooms are done in dark green marble, with a large tub and separate shower. Many amenities including slippers, robes, free bottled water and soda, coffee, and a generous buffet breakfast. At 165 euros per night, we thought the hotel offered exceptional value. The rooms facing the acropolis are larger with a knock-out view but considerable more expensive. The staff are the most honorable people we've ever encountered. On the day we arrived, I was unaware that a 20 euro note fell out of my pocket. The staff realized that it belonged to me and returned it. I also left a pair of earrings behind, and when we returned to the hotel after our cruise, they handed me the earrings! The only negative is that the hotel is on a very noisy, commercial street and one must walk through a few funky streets to get to the cafes and other sights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Eridanus Hotel during our recent honeymoon and while we liked it a lot I thought it was overpriced.
reviews.title: Great View!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What we liked:
reviews.title: Eridanus - Perfect start to holiday

likes.liked: — Everything, but especially our terrace with the views over the Acropolis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located on a busy commercial street but is in easy walking distance of all of the popular historic sites. We walked everywhere and even at night felt relatively safe. The Gazi District is just two blocks away and we loved having dinner there. (Sardelles and The Butcher Shop were our favorites! We didn't need reservations either night but they would probably be a good idea. It looks like restaurants hold reserved tables all evening. It is common to see an almost empty restaurant "fully booked.") Gazi is an exciting neighborhood with lots of clubs and restaurants and we really liked exploring the arts center that gives the neighborhood its name.
reviews.title: Love it, make sure you stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Eridanus (or Iridanus) Hotel came highly recommended in the Frommer's Guide on Greece. I was in Athens for 2 days with my spouse and decided to give this hotel a try based on the Frommer's Guide recommendation and those on TripAdvisor.
reviews.title: Good small boutique business hotel but needs some refinements

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel location is alright, though not the best. It is some walking distance from the Plaka and Keramikos areas and an even longer walk from the Acropolis. However, the top 2 floors do have lovely views of te Acropolis and I would strongly recommend a dinner at the roof top restaurant where you can dine with a full unobstructed view of the Acropolis at night. Its quite breathtaking. Not far from the hotel however, is a rather unsafe part of Athens filled with grafitti lined streets and not-so-desirable inhabitants. For a first time visitor to Athens, it can be quite scary.
reviews.title: Great Hotel.........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The interior of the hotel has been newly renovated and done up in a classic yet contemporary style. The rooms are clean and generally functional. Beds are firm and comfortable. Internet access is free in all rooms. There is also a small fitness centre and business centre. Most of the rooms do not have a good view so if you want a view of the Acropolis, you will need to specifically ask for one and be prepared to pay a bit more for that.
reviews.title: All round perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Breakfast spread was impressive with cooked eggs of your choice, waffles and crepes. However, the person serving us in the restaurant that morning was rather rude and displayed a poor attitude. In general, this seemed to be pervasive throughout the hotel - the staff are not so welcoming, nor warm and friendly.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel made our weekend a wonderful one

likes.liked: — The great staff and beautiful decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a nice small hotel but needs some improvements if it wants to be a really good or great one.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Room number 110 is very nice, it is a ‘deluxe’ room. The bathroom is beautiful. It’s great to have free water and soft drinks in the mini bar! The neighbourhood is not very good and the road next to the hotel is very noisy but with the windows closed you don’t hear a thing. Near is the earlier mentioned new metro station Kerameikos with a square attached with all kinds of trendy restaurants with outdoor seating, it looks very appealing. You can get a train to and from the airport which is very convenient. In the room there is an automated ‘do not disturb’ system but unfortunately room 110’s is broken so the light for ‘please make up my room’ is always on which is not what you want if you want to sleep in.
reviews.title: Nice room but not 5 star

likes.liked: — Beautiful room, free water and free soft drinks. Near Plaka.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel's check in desk is very friendly. The breakfast room staff was friendly too but I found them very slow. I arrived one morning to find a table for two free but they were in the process of resetting it. I had to ask for literally everything: a plate, a knife, coffee, milk for in the coffee. The response was always a very friendly ‘of course’ but it is not a five star service when you have to ask. One morning I asked for coffee, the boy walked away never to be seen again until I asked again. He was very surprised, he must have forgotten about it completely. I heard other people asking for things too: glasses, juice, etc.
reviews.title: Nothing 5 Star about the Eridanus Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because of the torrential rain I stayed in one night and ordered a drink in the bar. I was the only guest and had to wait 15 (!) minutes for my drink. The hotel doesn’t have ice cube machines although it is something you would expect (maybe not in Greece though?). An American lady walked into the bar to ask for a bucket of ice cubes. The girl behind the bar handed her a cup and saucer, the cup filled with ice cubes, not exactly what she asked for. In the bar, the drinks for the restaurant are prepared and staff keep walking up and down to serve them which makes it more a place of work than a place to sit back and relax. I didn’t like the bar at all.
reviews.title: Hip Luxury in Gazi

likes.liked: — Clean, stylish rooms. The bathrooms were amazing! Great attention to details in amenities.
likes.disliked: — Narrow sidewalks to neighboring cafes has you holding your breath as traffic passes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel all the time and use all kinds of hotels, also luxury ones and this room and bathroom are one of the prettiest I have had. Although everybody is trying, the service is not near a 5 star, yet… Hotel Eridanus is easy walking distance from the Plaka which I found surprisingly village like. The excavations all around the city are wonderful. Don’t get me wrong, it may not be perfect but I would certainly go back to Hotel Eridanus.
reviews.title: A little gem in Athens
